intro: Palicourea caldasana, commonly known as the Caldasana moonflower, is a climbing plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom at night. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
